oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Memphis - The Best Market for Everything
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: advertising; buildings; Business Men's Club; Loeb's Laundry; 1900s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A brochure advertising Memphis, compliments of Loeb's Laundry. Published between 1903 and 1910, the brochure sought to encourage people (and businesses) to move to Memphis "to show a population of a quarter of a million in 1910." Includes a description of the Business Men's Club and images of the following buildings or scenes: Porter Building, Randolph Building, Memphis Trust Co.'s New Building, Scimitar Building, Tennessee Trust Co.'s New Building, Main Street, Equitable Offices, Tennessee Club, The Cotton Exchange, Two Telephone Systems, Goodwyn Institute, One of Four Theatres, Hotel Gayoso, Peabody Hotel, The Only Mississippi Bridge South of St. Louis, The Great River Traffic at Memphis, Rafting Logs in Wolf River, The Fastest Mile Track in the Country, Cotton Field Near Memphis, Miles of Cotton in Memphis, Second Street - Wholesale Houses, N.E. Corner of Main & Court, Cossett Library, Custom House, Front Street Wholesale District, Madison Street to Post Office, Mammoth Livery, Boarding and Sale Stable, and Loeb's Laundry.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: C.B. Johnston & Co., Printers, 15 Washington St.
oai_dc:dc.dc:format: booklet, 16 pages, folded to 6 x 3.5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Ger096, Ger097, Ger098, Ger099, Ger100, Ger101, Ger102, Ger103, Ger104, Ger105, Ger106, Ger107, Ger108, Ger109, Ger110, Ger111
